english: Qin Shi Huang (first emperor of Qin)

etymology.description: 秦(Qin state) + 始(first) + 皇(emperor) = the First Emperor of Qin.
etymology.interpretation: Title literally means “Qin First Emperor,” naming the monarch who unified China in 221 BCE. Combines the state name with his ordinal status and sovereign rank.

parts.english: Qin (state/dynasty); surname; Shaanxi (abbrev); ancient feudal state

examples.chinese: 秦始皇统一六国(秦始皇統一六國)，建立了秦朝(建立了秦朝)。
examples.pinyin: Qín Shǐhuáng tǒngyī liù guó, jiànlì le Qíncháo.
examples.english: Qin Shi Huang unified the six states and founded the Qin dynasty.

examples.chinese: 他修筑万里长城(他修築萬里長城)，焚书坑儒(焚書坑儒)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiūzhù Wànlǐ Chángchéng, fénshū kēngrú.
examples.english: He reinforced the Great Wall and carried out book burning and the burying of scholars.

examples.chinese: 他的统治奠定了中国帝制的基础(他的統治奠定了中國帝制的基礎)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de tǒngzhì diàndìng le Zhōngguó dìzhì de jīchǔ.
examples.english: His rule laid the foundation for China’s imperial system.
